title: How to Make a Base for Soup

methods.name: Prepare a Basic Beef Stock for Soup Base

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Coarsely chop 1 carrot, 1 white onion, 1 celery stalk and 1 leek. Fine chop about 1 tsp. (5 mg) thyme and 1 tsp. (5 mg) parsley. Set the vegetables and herbs aside.

steps.headline: Brown the meat.
steps.description: Preheat a stock pot with 1 tbsp. cooking oil and add 4 to 5 oz. (100 to 150 g) of coarsely chopped beef. Brown the meat on all sides.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables and herbs to the pot.
steps.description: Add the vegetables to the stock pot and continue to cook the ingredients on medium heat until the vegetables begin to soften. Add the chopped herbs, 1 tsp. (5 mg) salt and 1 clove. Cover with water and let simmer for 20 minutes. Use a large spoon to skim any foam that rises to the top and continue to simmer for 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Strain and cool the stock.
steps.description: Remove the stock from heat, strain, and set aside to cool. Any fat content will congeal on top of the stock when cooled, and can be scooped-off the surface with a spoon and discarded. Reserve or discard the fat as preferred.

methods.name: Prepare a Basic Chicken or Poultry Stock for Soup Base

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Coarsely chop 1 carrot, 1 leek, 1 stalk celery and 1 medium-sized white onion. Finely chop 1 tsp. (5 mg) thyme and 1 tsp. (5 mg) parsley. Set the herbs and vegetables aside.

steps.headline: Cook the meat.
steps.description: Preheat a stock pot on medium heat with 1 tbsp. of margarine or butter. Place 14 to 18 oz. (400 � 500 g) of chicken wings in the stock pot and slightly brown the skin of the meat before adding the vegetables and herbs.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables and season the stock.
steps.description: Stir in the vegetables and add 1 tsp. (5 mg) salt, 1 tsp. (5 mg) white pepper and 1 clove. Cover with water and let simmer 25 to 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Strain and cool the stock.
steps.description: Remove the stock from heat, strain and set aside to cool. Once cooled, any fat content will congeal and collect on the surface of the stock, making it easy to scoop off with a spoon and discard.

steps.headline: Prepare the bouquet-garni.
steps.description: Tie together 4 sage leaves, 2 parsley sprigs, 2 bay leaves, 1 thyme sprig and 2 rosemary sprigs into a tight bundle using a piece of cooking string.

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Coarsely chop 2 oz. (60 g) white onion, 2 oz. (60 g) shallots, and 5 oz. (150 g) mushroom stems or trimmings. Set the chopped vegetables aside.

steps.headline: Prepare the stock.
steps.description: Add 5.5 lbs. (2.5 kg) of white fish scraps (unused portions like the tail, head, fins, etc.) from cod, sole, whiting, turbot or any other type of white fish to a preheated stock-pot. Add the chopped vegetables and mushroom trimmings to the pot. Add 2 cups (.5 l) white wine, .33 oz. (10 g) sea salt, 1 tsp. (5 g) white pepper and the juice from half of a lemon. Cover with water and add the bouquet-garni. Bring the stock to a boil and skim off any foam that floats to the top. Boil the stock for 30 minutes and strain through cheesecloth.

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Coarsely chop 2 medium carrots, 1 white onion, 2 large celery stocks, 5 oz. (150 g) mushroom stems or trimmings, and 1 leek (peeled and trimmed).

steps.headline: Prepare the stock.
steps.description: Cook the vegetables slowly in 1 tbsp. butter or margarine on medium heat until they begin to become tender. Cover with boiling water and add 1 bouquet-garni. Season with 1 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. white pepper and simmer the stock for 25 to 30 minutes. Skim any foam that rises to the top. Strain the stock through a cheesecloth and set aside to cool.
